@graph.name: Dracula’s blood punch recipe
@graph.description: Halloween is all about getting spooky! And what better way to achieve the ultimate Halloween bevvy for your monster bash than a frightening drink like this non alcoholic blood punch recipe?
recipeIngredient: 1  small red chili (left whole but pierced a few times)
simple syrup if you want your drink sweeter. (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the cherry juice into a large saucepan and add orange peel, chili, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the cherry juice into a large saucepan and add orange peel, chili, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Leave to cool, then chill for a few hours or up to 2 days – the longer you leave it the more intense the flavors.
recipeInstructions.name: Leave to cool, then chill for a few hours or up to 2 days – the longer you leave it the more intense the flavors.

recipeInstructions.text: If serving to young children, take the chili out after simmering or skip altogether.
recipeInstructions.name: If serving to young children, take the chili out after simmering or skip altogether.

recipeInstructions.text: When you’re ready to serve, pour the juice into a pitcher.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve in champagne glasses or jars/mugs with a straw in each.
